conclusion: Analyze forces acting on sphere A using problem conditions
Sphere A is on inclined plane, sphere B is to the right at same height
Gravitational force acts vertically downward with magnitude mg
Normal force acts perpendicular to the inclined plane
Electrostatic force acts horizontally to the right due to repulsion from sphere B with magnitude kq^2/d^2
Tension in the wire is 0, does not contribute to forces
Resolve gravitational force into components parallel and perpendicular to inclined plane
Gravitational force parallel to inclined plane is mg sin θ
Gravitational force perpendicular to inclined plane is mg cos θ
Sphere is stationary, net force in parallel and perpendicular directions must be zero
Component of gravitational force parallel to plane is balanced by electrostatic force: mg sin θ = kq^2/d^2
Rearrange equation to solve for q/d: q^2 = mgd^2 sin θ/k
Final answer: q/d = sqrt(mg sin θ/k)
